title: Multimodal Large Language Models for Text-rich Image Understanding: A Comprehensive Review
author: Pei Fu (Meituan), Tongkun Guan (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Zining Wang (Meituan), Zhentao Guo (Beijing Institute of Technology), Chen Duan (Meituan), Hao Sun (MAIS & NLPR, Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences), Boming Chen (Meituan), Jiayao Ma (Meituan), ..., Junfeng Luo (Meituan)
relevance_why: The discussion on multimodal large language models integrating text and visual data provides insights that could inform future advancements in audio-language modeling, particularly regarding feature integration and model architecture.
background: Text-rich image understanding involves processing images that contain significant textual information to automate information extraction and enhance user interactions.
contribution: This paper introduces a systematic survey of Text-rich Image Understanding multimodal large language models, analyzing their architectures, training pipelines, and challenges faced in the field.

technical_comparison.previous_methods: Traditional models for text-rich images often utilized separate processing pipelines for text and visual data, limiting efficiency and adaptability.
technical_comparison.novelty: The paper reveals how recent multimodal large language models offer an integrated approach, applying unified architecture for concurrent processing of visual and textual information, enhancing inferencing capabilities.

key_innovation: Showcases the evolution from specialized models to unified architectures integrating visual recognition and semantic reasoning, thereby improving contextual understanding in multimodal scenarios.
real_world_impact: The advancements discussed could significantly affect applications in document analysis, visual question answering, and other areas requiring a nuanced understanding of images with embedded text.
limitations: The authors acknowledge the challenge of tracking rapid advancements in MLLMs and potential gaps in existing surveys.

new_terms.Text-rich Image Understanding: **Text-rich Image Understanding** refers to the capability to analyze and interpret images that prominently feature text for improved information extraction and user engagement.
new_terms.Multimodal Large Language Models: **Multimodal Large Language Models** integrates various forms of data, particularly text and images, to understand and generate responses that leverage both modalities.
